transportAdvice: Essaouira's compact medina is highly walkable and most attractions are easily reached on foot; taxis are widely available for trips to the beach or bus station. Long-distance buses connect the city to Marrakech and other major Moroccan cities, making it accessible without a private vehicle.

weather.description: Cool and occasionally rainy with strong Atlantic winds making it feel colder than the temperature suggests.
Similar to January with mild temperatures and breezy conditions; rain showers are possible but not constant.
Gradually warming with fewer rain days and pleasant breezes making it a comfortable time to explore.
Mild and mostly sunny with refreshing sea breezes; a good shoulder-season month for visiting.
Warm and largely dry with consistent Atlantic winds that keep temperatures comfortable along the coast.
Early summer brings steady winds and mild heat; popular with windsurfers and kitesurfers due to strong breezes.
Peak summer is surprisingly mild compared to inland Morocco thanks to the cooling ocean influence and persistent winds.
The warmest month of the year but still tempered by Atlantic breezes; busy with visitors escaping inland heat.
Warm and pleasant with winds beginning to ease slightly; an excellent month for beach and cultural activities.
Comfortable autumn temperatures with occasional light rain returning; crowds thin out and conditions remain enjoyable.
Cooler and wetter with more frequent Atlantic storms; a quieter period but still mild enough for sightseeing.
Cool winter weather with a chance of rain and strong winds; the medina is atmospheric and uncrowded during this period.
